sentences: Catherine Comet (born 1944) is a French-born, American conductor who from 1986 to 1997 was the music director of the Grand Rapids Symphony in Grand Rapids, Michigan, becoming the first woman to hold a post as music director of a professional orchestra in the United States.
During her 11-year tenure with the Grand Rapids Symphony, she also served as music director of the American Symphony Orchestra.
She received the Seaver/National Endowment for the Arts Conductors Award in 1988.
From 1984 to 1986, Comet was associate conductor of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra.
Official biography at the Wayback Machine (archived 27 September 2007)
